reviews.review_text: Without a doubt, the best Japanese restaurant I have ever tried in Vancouver. For its great quality of product, flavor, very fresh fish, spectacular dishes prepared by amazing chefs, variety of good drinks, good atmosphere where to enjoy good food and magnificent friendly staff! I really enjoyed dinner there with my friend! A very special place! We will be back, thank you guys!!

Love dinning here with my friends! The food is always delicious and artistic! Love how they support local farmers and have unique high quality ingredients. When I was poor college student, I usually got the okonomiyaki or one of the stone bowls, one caterpillar roll, and 1 dessert and that was enough to satisfy me and my friend. I usually got something that was high in carbs that way it fills me up. That way it doesnt go over my budget. Now, I get anything from their special menu, its always different depending on the seasons. I am never disappointed what I am about to taste. The service is good and friendly! The atmosphere there is calming, chill, classy. The music in that restaurant is very relaxing in my opinion. Also, the tables are always clean and same with the dishes and cutlery. Tip: This place is quite popular so the wait time to get a table might take long (1hr +). So I suggest you make a reservation, come at 5pm, or eat a small snack before you go but that depends on your eating schedule.
Amazing,  tight and focused menu.  Every dish was a work of art and tasted spectacular.  Has to be the best sushi Ive had. Will have to come back again

My favourite place at all time! I ve always visited Kishimioto for their famous grilled Gindara! It s one of the best I ve ever tried so far! This time I ve booked their Kaiseki course (7-8 courses), I got to say the presentation was on point    and the whole course was phenomenal!!! They have their very unique in house made sauces and the flavour is so strong it melts in your mouth. I enjoyed the whole course and the theme syncing with the season .

So, the real question is not whether the food is awesome, it is! It is not whether the service is amazing, it is! The real question is whether a 45min-1 hr wait is worth it ?! So if you are planning to come in a large group, you should call ahead, or indeed be the first to come in, otherwise the wait times, make it only accessible to die hards or those that know, that its worth the wait. If you can find a place nearby to grab a drink with friends after you have put your name down, then time flies. So for me, I can say, that the 45 minute wait time, even though seemed long, flew quickly and the food was worth the wait. We didnt order any alcohol, just green tea, and our bill was OK.
We went right at 5pm to have dinner. We ordered, sockeye salmon, scallop rolls, caterpillar rolls, had the ebi oshi and the miso soup. Everything was nicely presented and the food was delicious.

I went for the first time today. The atmosphere is so incredibly calm, the service very attentive and the kitchen very calm and organized. I had the spicy salmon roll and it was delicious. My friend had the sashimi salad and it was delicious as well. Coming from a former cook & server used to the service industry, kishimoto does everything right, even down to the plating of the food. 10/10 would come again

So I went to Kishimoto before COVID and after. I remember the food and service to be quite good. My most recent visit was excellent though and I tried a very reasonable variety of food. The prices are mid to high but  I cant complain about the quality and taste. Its actually quite fairly priced for the quality of food youre getting though, Ive seen other places charge more or the same for much worse quality. If I had any slight criticism of Kishimoto is that no reservations and small restaurant make it difficult to make a visit as a group.

Authentic Japanese cuisine in a cozy and elegant setting.  Artistically presented and reasonably priced.  Everything we ordered was freshly prepared and very satisfying.  I highly recommend their Oshi as well as their sushi rolls.  More expensive but also unlike any other sushi  I ve tried in Vancouver.

The flavors in everything we ordered were immaculate Each dish was prepared with such attention to detail both in flavor profile and presentation -- if I could eat my way through the entire menu I would !! Definitely go !!

The atmosphere at the restaurant was calm and relax, staff was nice, the owner was super kind and thoughtful. All the dishes were amazing, you can tell they put a lot of effort on all their dishes! Good portions too! Good spot for dates and with groups of friends. Will go again!

My favourite Japanese restaurant ever. It run by the nicest people, the staff are basically like a family. The photos I took aren t even all of it, the food is beautiful and tastes even better!!! The black cod misozuke literally melts in you mouth!!! They have a seasonal menu which is always delicious. They source foods locally when they can! They are always trying to create new dishes. I can t wait for the bar seating to open back up so we can watch and chat with the chefs!! When I have friends and family visit Vancouver, this is always the first place I want to bring them!! Here one tip I have if you are new: get the smoked Oshi!!!! It melts in your mouth and leaves a Smokey flavour that lingers even minutes after you are done.

Loved the food here! You go here to eat. Thats it. Didnt try drinks but looked authentic. Had the eel (unagi) rolls. Amazing. The smoked sushi was just ok. Would not get again. Fresh and tasty. A bit pricy, so only go if you appreciate good sushi.

Small restaurant seats about 30-40 and there is always a wait.  Id rate it as one of the top Japanese places to eat at in Vancouver.  Attentive service and the food was spectacular.  I never once used soy on any othe the items ordered and the flavours coming from the dishes were amazing.  Definitely will take my significant other here to see what she thinks.

What a great experience from start to finish. Couldnt have asked for a better service or culinary experience. I had a seat at the bar looking into the kitchen and it was great just watching the level of care taken with each dish. I highly recommend Kishimoto!

Amazing and authentic Japanese restaurant. On the pricier end, but not outrageous and definitely worth it. Regular sushi staples are priced reasonable, and you can also try some of the fancier menu items as well. The quality and freshness of sashimi is of a high standard. Some items are imported from the famous Tsukiji Fish Market in Tokyo. Restaurant is gets busy quick, reservations are definitely recommended. If there is a wait, its 100% worth it. Great selection of sake.

Other than the fact that this place uses exclusively comic sans as a font for all their menus (why???), this might be our favourite sushi spot in all of Vancouver. The fish is incredibly fresh and so so good. Even the dessert we ordered   deep fried ice cream is fantastic. Definitely come here for very fresh sushi and excellent service!

Best Japanese I ve had and I ve been to different parts of Japan several times and have l. The smoked salmon oshi was the best pressed sushi I ve had. The chirashi is a bento looking sushi dish with many types of raw fish presented in a decadent fashion. So good. The eggplant and the fried tofu were both really creatively made but very delicious. Service was great and we went in at 8:15 on a Saturday. No wait at all. Will return everytime we visit Vancouver.

There are a lot of good places to eat sushi in Vancouver but Kishimoto serves up cuisine that not only pleases your taste buds but your nose, eyes, and soul! Here you can have food that changes your appreciation for what food is and should and could be. I can t wait to be back!

This restaurant was highly regarded by my girlfriend so I had to go; and, oh boy, it did not disappoint. I went with my girlfriend and 2 others; I was glad there were 4 of us so we could order and try more! We couldn t make reservations as it was already booked to the max but luckily they take walk in. We got lucky and only waited about 40 mins for a table. We ordered Yam Tempura, Bluefin Negitoro roll, Salmon Oshi, Ebi Oshi, Unagi Oshi, Saba Oshi and Spicy Tuna Oshi. I honestly don t remember how the Yam Tempura and Bluefin Negitoro roll were but I m sure they were good; they were out shined by the boxed sushi. We originally only ordered the Unagi Oshi and the Salmon Oshi, but they were soo good we ordered the Ebi Oshi, Saba Oshi and Spicy Tuna Oshi. My favourite was Unagi Oshi but you can t go wrong with any of them! I will be definitely coming back.

Exceptional & consistent every time. This is a neighbourhood gem! The sushi quality is high and their kitchen dishes (especially the nabeyaki udon) is incredible. Reservations are highly recommended as it fills up fast - if youre doing take out, call right at 5pm when they open to get through their phone line.

A really fancy Japanese restarting in a post of Vancouver thats not known for high end restaurant. The prices are on the high side but the quality is worth it. They make some really unique sushi pieces that Ive not seen anywhere else. The nabeyaki udon is also incredible. The broth is so flavourful and the ingredients are really well prepared. Two troll thumbs up!!! +(O____o)+

I am delighted and surprised. Kishimoto is quite well known in Vancouver but it havent make it to my eatery list until now. The restaurant doesnt look like any conventional sushi joint, but having constant line up tells another story. According to the hostess, there is an one hour average of waiting and weekend could be longer; but she assures me the wait is well worth it! Since we are looking at the chef preparing our meal, we are delighted on the amount of time and effort the chef has put in. Often times, we see the master will spot check the food and would take over to help out. As soon as our dishes are made, the chefs already move onto other orders. The little details also include their home made tamarind based soy sauce and other dipping condiments that go with certain dishes. The staff advises us which fish to start first and which dipping goes with which. We are no strangers to certain raw fish characters and happy to see the staff to spend the time to make introductions. Although constantly busy, the delicacy of the food and fast turnaround makes this subtle Japanese restaurant in the Commercial Drive area shines brighter than other fancier restaurants in Vancouver.

We tried the Kaiseki menu (pictured below). From my understanding, it is like a tasting menu specifically chosen by the chef. It was actually quite the experience. You will see the chef will personally prepare your food. He will also serve it and explain the different types of dishes. The food was absolutely amazing. I think for the price we paid for, it was well worth it for both the experience and the good food.
Exceptional presentation, well prepared, location is good.

Very delicious, worth the price. Most of the food tasted fresh. Great place if you have a taste for eel and duck. Service was very good and fast. Best to call for a reservation a week or two in advanced. Line isnt so long for the first 20 min at opening hours. Previous reviews regarding negative service fail to mention that the staff are human beings working in a restaurant that always has a line up out the door. The experience was completely positive. For price reference, it was $100 bucks total for two adult men.
I ve never had a bad meal here! I ve been eating here for years and each time is just as good. It s my go to spot whenever I m craving sushi. Can t say enough good things about this place!

The quality of the food here is unparalleled. The sashimi melted in my mouth, the maki was presented in the most delightful way with a candle and little carrot slices cut into butterflies, and the smoked oshi sushi served under a cloche with cherry wood smoke was to die for. On top of that, staff were welcoming, friendly, and attentive. I will definitely be coming again.

Sushi selection was really fresh and delicious.  Some really unique sushi variations here so if youre looking for something new and something familiar this is a great place to get both! Theres a black cod nigiri on the menu but not always available.  If its on the menu, order it!  Single best sushi bite Ive had in years!
Met a friend here for sushi and was impressed.  Vancouver never disappoints with seafood, but this sushi joint has great atmosphere and yummy dishes.

My first time at Kishimoto, a small out of the way place. We ordered several smoked oshi, special ordered some assortment of sashimi but we wanted it seared and flavoured finished with some garnish. Plus I ordered the unagi oshi. The cherry wood smoked salmon oshi was a hit, visually. As well the infused scented smoke made the taste when eating of the oshi very memorable. Sashimi was a hit as well flavour from the bluefin tuna was excellent. Unagi oshizushi was so good I had half the order myself. We finished off by ordering another round of smoked oshi. Very impressed with the presentation and overall taste profile. I highly recommend eating here. I look forward to the next time we eat here.
One of the top Japanese dining experiences I ve had in Vancouver. Can t go wrong with the menu but I would recommend the duck soba.
The food is amazing! The udon soup broth is the best I have ever tried so far! Sashimi is super fresh and they take on a very eye catching and detailed food presentation!

Kishimoto definitely hit the spot in terms of quality of food! The presentation is fantastic as you can. See from the photos! Although the price point is a tad higher than I would appreciate, this was easily overshadowed by the flavor of the sushi and food I ordered. I always appreciate when the wasabi and soya sauce is already blended into the nigiri! Vegetarian options: Theres a couple of vegetarian options at the time I went such as a beet salad Wheelchair accessibility: Sidewalk level entrance and restaurant

Cozy restaurant for sure. Love the friendliness of staffs and they are following covid 19 protocols. This is not the standard sushi restaurant. Its quality based and quite unique taste and ideas towards the food. It may be a be a little priceir than other sushi restaurant, but u definitely get the quality.   Love their Smokey sushi! And their duck soba!

Theres usually a bit of a wait but its definitely worth it. The seafood is very fresh and very high quality. The decor and ambiance is lively but not too noisy that you cant have a conversation. Staff are friendly and helpful. Will definitely come back.

This staple on Commercial DR is basically a piece of Miku without the very high prices and ambiance, such good food though. Still more expensive than a typical to go restaurant, but do eat in as the presentation and care is so good at this authentic place. The aburi here is as good as Miku or Minami.

UHmazing sushi & sashimi I can understand why people say it s expensive, but I think if you order sushi, sashimi & some rice / noodle dishes then it wouldnt break the bank. Oshi & sashimi are the must, obviously. Other than that, we had the rice in the Hamachi Ishinabe (rice in a hot stone bowl) which everyone thought was really good. I would order it again. The only thing we didnt like that much was the snowcrab nigiri (I thought it was okay). If you go by yourself or 2ppl And would not mind sitting at the bar, you would get to see that pretty quickly. We had a party of four adults and two kids and waited for just over an hour. I would say it was well worth it.

Small wait time on a Thursday night. Food came out fast because we preordered while we were waiting to be seated. The smoked salmon sushi was pretty good. The stonepot rice was a little bit salty but ok. Overall nice Japanese restaurant. Price is a bit high so would only come here again on a special occasion.
Gorgeous presentation of delicious dishes. Always a lovely experience every time we go. Staff are kind, and service is great.

I d recommend this intimate, cozy restaurant to all my friends and family. Excellent spot for a date night with a loved one or a splurge dinner with friends and family. The highlights were the salmon belly, fried chicken karaage, and the soba duck noodles. Service was friendly and attentive, and the restaurant was quiet and dimly lit which is perfect for a cozy evening of indulgence.

Wild salmon rolls (spicy) and salmon sashimi are a must. Remember to get the wild salmon ones and not the farm version. Nice presentation. Walk in only. Eel rice was pretty good unless you don t like fatty fish. We were not keen on the miso baked oysters though.
Great place for a nice Sushi dinner! The staff also gave us a good explanation of all the dishes and helped us in choosing the best matching food for our taste. The Ohsi is a must try!

First time getting take out from Kishimoto and WOW!! Great presentation and outstanding freshness & flavour. The little details like the spiral radish garnish and the ginger butterfly were appreciated

Kishimoto serves up some truly delicious dishes. The uni chawanmushi was perfectly silky. The various oshi sushis are all tasty. The tempura ice cream was a nice finish to a fantastic dinner. In fact, everything we ordered was top quality and the service was excellent as always. Definitely one of Vancouvers top sushi restaurants.

Wow, what an amazing food experience. Kashimoto delivers on all aspects of a perfect restaurant experience. Beautiful decor and atmosphere, food flavours delicately balanced and unique, service was attentive, fast, and friendly. The whole package! The ebi mayo sampler had unique flavours out of the traditional norm, the oishi sushi was flavourful, the smoked sushi brought a great smoked flavour that didnt overpower the delicate fish, the mushrooms was mouthfuls of umami, the doban mushi was a new  mouth-warming shroomy broth of an experience, and the Wagyu tataki was mouthfuls of butter complemented with shrooms and crunchy garlic bits. Will definitely be coming back when were in town next!
It s a very good authentic Japanese restaurant without flying to Japan. Got to try if you are in Vancouver wanting good Japanese food

Always a lovely dining experience and a gem generally only known to locals. Very fresh sashimi, creative fusion dishes, and stellar service. Most recent time we ordered the wagyu beef sashimi, sockeye salmon and akami tuna. Too bad they already ran out of toro. We wanted to try the okra appetizer as well but they sold out as well. Excellent pandemic protocols and practices in the restaurant. They dont seat anyone at the bar (they also need the counter to prepare a lot of takeout orders, as per the wait staff), and tables were truly more than 6 feet apart. There were even hand sanitizers at EACH table - fantastic. Well done, Kishimoto. Will return and highly recommend.

Probably my favourite Japanese restaurant of those I visited during my recent Vancouver trip. Felt safe as the staff blocked off every other table for physical distancing. Amazingly fresh and innovative food. My favourites were the nasu dengaku (fried eggplant with sweet saikyo miso sauce), the hotate nigiri, and the black cod misozuke. The presentation of the smoked oshi had a wow factor and there was a definite smokiness that was imparted to the oshi. No advance reservations but the wait was well worth it.

Excellent dining experience! Felt like the quality of fine dining, at a reasonable price. We will definitely come back to try more that they have to offer, but each item that they had on the menu that we were lucky enough to taste was well-thought-out, well balanced, and delicious! The service as well definitely help them earn 5 stars!!
The best sushi I ever had in Vancouver. Amazing quality of food and service. I ll definitely come back.

Great quality menu with some authentic Japanese options.  The design of the restaurant even with covid is still very open and warm, with the kitchen front and centre.  Would love to do a tasting menu here!!  We started with miso, then agedashi tofu, gyoza, 2 rolls which didnt make the photo because they were too good, then had okonomiyaki and chicken karaage.  All in all a lovely meal.  Service was lovely as well, will return.  Note:  the chicken has a lot of white pepper on it, which has a bit of an overpowering taste versus the bold flavor of the chicken.  The okonomiyaki was good, but also not traditional japanese style and no noodles.  Both are still good, just different from Tokyo.  Will return!!

Best Japanese restaurant in the area by far. Ive heard many rave reviews about it and decided to give it a try. It gets incredibly busy so be prepared for long line ups. I waited approximately 30-40 minutes at 7:30. Ordered the Salmon Oshi, Unagi Oshi, Tuna Maki, and Hotate with Uni Sauce. For something as simple as a maki roll, it was the best Ive ever tasted. Amazingly fresh and filled with a generous portion of tuna. Hotate and uni were incredible, finished off with a super creamy uni sauce. Their oshi is fantastic as well; constructed well and tasted great! Their service is also great and fast. Although this restaurant is considered pricier than other restaurants, I would still visit this location more often than others. The quality and service cannot be matched. Highly recommended!

LOVE THIS PLACE! I really like the Smoked Oshi (I call it Campfire sushi). It is really Good!! If you ever get a chance to try Ebi Okonomiyaki , you should! Its the perfect comfort food! The service is awesome, they always check my water if its full or not, and also to see if I need anything.

Excellent food and service. Its worth it to note that you should line up before they start their dinner service. Their rice dishes tends to be a little salty or have just a bit too much sauce masking the original flavor. Overall a great eat, and worth trying their smoke infused oshi.

Kishimoto has been on my list of places to try for a long time, and finally I have been able to try this place. The smoked oshi and sous vide duck soba are a must try! I don t normally order oshi, but this was so smokey and flavourful. The soba comes with a dashi broth you dip the noodles and it is so light, but has so much flavour at the same time. Coming back to try more things off their menu :)

This is my new favorite restaurant. Too bad I live in Houston and not Vancouver. The service is amazing and consistent (I went there 2 nights in a row). The food is excellent. So much flavor and the presentation is just beautiful. There wasnt 1 dish that my bf and I ordered that we didnt like and we even tried stuff out of our comfort zone like the pickled saba maki, which we fell in love with its refeshing flavor. We came in around 8 pm on Saturday and Sunday night and the wait at most was around 20 min. Totally worth it and I highly recommend this place. Im a huge foodie and the freshness, presentation, and great service here will keep me coming back!

The food is on a very high level.  Ingredients are the best - uni, salmon, tuna are all exceptional, and even the shiso is fresh and delicate and comes with flower buds. The salmon skin in the salmon skin rolls is cherry wood smoked, delicious! Try the cauliflower karaage.  Try the salmon oshi, smoked at your table.  Kishimotos prices arent low, but their food is memorable.

First time here yesterday, came in, was told the wait was going to be about 30mins for two and they would text or call 10mins before the food was ready. Which is great, you can go walk around commercial while you wait. We got a text within 20mins so we rushed back and the table was ready for us when we got there. Sat down, got waters right away. Everyone is very welcoming. Food came out in a reasonable time, maybe 15 minutes upon ordering? Food is very good. The karage wasnt super oily. Done well. I love Aburi and this place wasnt as good as the other ones Ive had but it was up there. The spicy tuna one is different, but still very good. My favourite was the dragon roll. Dont know why, but it was perfect. Tempted to order another one. Definitely a great place for a date or a small group of 4. Cant wait to come back to try more!

We ordered takeouts from Kishimoto. They are well packaged and fresh tasting. We love their Ebi Oshi and salmon Oshi. The cold noodle is nice for the summer but there isn t much taste to it. Bluefin negitoro rolls are super fresh! Also love their omg roll.

I cant say enough good things about this place. First the service is amazing, food is fresh, light, melt in your mouth delicious. Very beautiful, simple decor and the ambiance is relaxed and comfortable. The menu is varied, even with some of the food restrictions, everyone in our party of six found something to eat. My favourites of the night were the AHI Avocado, Sashimi Salad (I can probably have that for every meal, yes including breakfast!) and the Sashimi 5 kind. The price point is higher then most sushi places I tend to visit bit it was worth ever penny.
I m a big fan of the decor and atmosphere of the restaurant. Not your traditional sushi restaurant, they have some interesting options and the price reflects that. Overall, had a great experience!
The staff was lovely and the chef went above and beyond. We were a group of 5 and the chef added extra pieces to ensure we could all share!!!
Was recommended highly by friends and definitely did not disappoint. I will be back for sure. The smoked oshi was deadly.

The hype surrounding this restaurant is well deserved. Fun menu, personable and fast service. Fantastic quality sashimi. The oshi aburi pressed sushi is balanced and exciting to eat. I recommend this place highly! <3

Great service. Food was a special experience. Nasu denkaku was fried instead of grilled like other places. The selection of fish was good and very fresh. You can ask them for aburi version of the sushi which means likely torched on the outside. Nothing bad to say about this place.

Came here on a double date and weren t disappointed. Couldn t get a reservation around 7pm but got a table as a walk-in (required a 40-45minute wait). Had their aburi oshi sushi, black cod misozuke, sous vide duck soba, agedashi tofu,

Another great sushi restaurant in Vancouver - love this place. I usually order the Oshizushi as the flavouring is so unique - salmon Oshi with the flame searing is by far my favourite. I ve ordered the other classics before and they are just as tasty. I ve never booked reservations but have often had to wait 5-10 mins to get in, so reservation definitely recommended if you can plan ahead!

This is one of the best sushi restaurants I have ever been to in Vancouver. Fresh, Fair price, and very tasty. I will definitely be coming back here. And I love this guy. He works during the day, and is a director by night.

Awesome staff and fantastic meal.  Oshi sushi and Tsukiji sashimi were great.  Had such a good time I went back a second night for Okonomiyaki.  Many different items to choose from if youre not big on sushi.  Will be back again.
Simply delicious. Great service, fairly priced and very well presented. So far, our favorite in Vancouver!

You wont regret waiting for a long time to eat here.  Been here 3 times and been satisfied every SINGLE time. The salmon oshi sushi,  for the price that it is, totally worth it.  My friend felt in love and had to sit there for a second to calm himself after trying the spicy tuna oshi sushi!  I guess if you order the common items you wont be as stoked as for the special items they have!  Sad that they dont have uni on the menu but its definitely a must to try this place once in your life!

One of my favourite restaurants in Vancouver! We did takeout this time around because the wait was too long. I love how they dont use styrofoam. The oshi sushi was delicious as always. It was the first time we tried the hamachili roll and its one of our new favourites. The flavour combination was just right (I love the bit of kick too). Im a huge chopped scallop fan but it disappointed this time around. There was too much sauce and it overwhelmed the delicate scallop taste. Bummer. Overall, still one of my favourite sushi restaurants! Just be prepared for a wait if youre not in line before the restaurant opens.
The food was amazing and so was the service. The flavors of the food were amazing and the server was super at suggesting some of their unique dishes. Will definitely be back.
beautiful dishes! It took a minute to touch my food   also taste was also great!

Really good sushi. Bit of a wait on a walk-in table, which is fair enough. The black cod is sublime. Most of the rolls we tried were amazing. One of the fried rolls was really quite tough and chewy but had a great flavour. Not the cheapest, but good quality.

Food was fresh and was display with great artistically. (Carrot butterflies. etc) service was above par and prices were very reasonable. High level of cleanliness that one would expect from a true sushi restaurant.
Chu toro was great. Otoro was similarly good. Ikura tasted fresh. Go if you can and ask for Omakase.

Best sushi weve had in a long time!! And we have sushi often. went to walk by on a Sunday evening and there was a 20 minute wait for a table. Good to see this place is busy but not unattainable. This food was So unbelievably good and service was great the server was awesome And all the chefs waved at us when we left. try the smokey salmon oshi specialty....you wont be disappointed. We ordered 2 of everything again hah...we were super hungry tho, good portions. Thanks again guys!! Will be back!!

The place was cozy yet classy, the sushi and other options were outstanding and enticing (we kept asking what our neighbours were enjoying), the staff friendly and knowledgeable, and the raw materials were expertly crafted into delicious sushi that was the perfect size to eat whole. Made our evening! Warmly recommended!
The food was really good. Very tasty and would definitely go back again!

This was honestly one of the best sushi Ive had. The fish was delicious and melt in your mouth. The karaage and wagyu beef was awesome as well. This restaurant is more expensive than other places ($160 for 2 with 2 beer) but it was totally worth it and will be back next time Im in Vancouver.
The beet salad is this incredible spiral creation and sashimi is served on a slab of ice ! The food is delicious and priced fairly. Definitely a good date spot.
Very unique Japanese, cozy atmosphere, service is very good . Good are beautifully represented, very artistic dishes , great and tasteful

Friends hosted us to this outstanding restaurant! It is owned and operated by true Japanese artisans, and the food was the best traditional Japanese food I have ever experienced. This is a small, not easily found restaurant, that is very much worth the effort. If you like this cuisine, this restaurant must be on your list.

Ive been here a few times before, both on my own and with friends, and its always been exemplary with great service and fantastic food.  One time I didnt realize that my friends werent into fish/seafood, and the menu options still made for a fantastic meal.  Today though I ordered both the  Mushroom Saute and the Chirashi, and this is the first meal in quite some time that I wanted to drag out as long as possible.  The flavours  of both were exquisite, and the presentation of the Chirashi was delightful and unexpected (my wording does not do this meal justice).  Im not one to take pictures of my meal but I wish I would have just to post it up here.
Me and my fiances favourite sushi spot. Hamachilli roll is the best roll in the world
Very enjoyable dining experience. Great food and service. The best is the aburi. Must go !

One of the best sushi places, albeit a bit pricey (but worth it, better value than Mimi)... highlight was the Himachi Rice Bowl. Karage at other places is oily greasy but these guys perfected it! Sushi rolls, both regular and pressed, is perfect! Yuki, the server is one the best in business!
The best sushi I ve had. Everything is so fresh and perfectly flavoured. It was packed on a Saturday evening and had a 45 min wait so we did takeout and even that did it total justice.
Sashimi and Karaage were great! Most everything was made with detail and care.

Absolutely legendary dinner experience. The wife and I spent two weeks in Vancouver trying a new spot for dinner every night. This was by far the best dinner we had our entire trip. Well worth the struggle to get a reservation. You MUST try the Smoke Oshi. It will blow your mind
Lived up to my expectations. Delicious oshi sushi. Extremely busy but if youre alone, you might get a seat at the bar with no waits.
Best sushi and sashimi that I ve ever had. I opted to try the sashimi flown in fresh from Japan. Expensive, but worth the price.
delicious sushi and for a small space does a good job of social distancing.
better than miku. really liked it, and its rated in top 2-3 sushi restaurants in vancouver since 2015 (vancouver east atleast)
Had a lovely dinner here the other night! The quality was amazing for the price. Everything was presented uniquely and beautifully. Great little spot! Would recommend to call for a reso.
everything was amazing but I want to shout out the new kikos sorbet dessert feature. really creative and detail-oriented
Very very busy sushi joint on commercial drive.  Artistic and tasty!  Sometimes might feel rushed, but its just that busy of a place.
Great food also excellent attentive service. Kid-friendliness: They provide highchair and kids utensils. Food : 5/5 |
